page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: The houses in the Townhead estate, and in the Easterhouse estate, are almost entirely owned by the district councils and rented to tenants. Townhead is typical of Coatbridge, which has over 80% of its households living in local authority housing. There is a strip of owner-occupied housing built along the E-W Townhead Road in the 1930s, but in the 1950s the large council estate was built over what was until then farmland. Most of the estate is two-storey housing, with semi-detacheds and terracing : at the western edge near the golf course are some single-storey old people's sheltered houses ; and in the centre of the estate is Witchwood Court, a multi-storey block. Although Coatbridge has ten such blocks, this
